docs.snippet: The Jets’ offensive coordinator Marty Mornhinweg is well known for his pass-first approach, and Rex Ryan appears to welcome that....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Jets’ offensive coordinator Marty Mornhinweg is well known for his pass-first approach, and Rex Ryan appears to welcome that.
docs.abstract: New York Jets offensive coordinator Marty Mornhinweg is well known for his pass-first approach, and Rex Ryan appears to welcome that; quarterback Geno Smith's performance so far, raises questions about his ability to lead that kind of offense so soon, but Mornhinweg says Smith is learning on the job.

headline.main: Jets Are Taking a Pass on the Running Game
headline.print_headline: Jets Are Taking a Pass On the Running Game

docs.lead_paragraph: The Scarlet Knights have two nonscholarship athletes starting in the backfield: running back Paul James and fullback Michael Burton.
docs.abstract: Rutgers running back Paul James and fullback Michael Burton, both walk-ons, make up what Rutgers believes to be the only nonscholarship starting backfield for a major college in the country; James leads the Football Bowl Subdivision with 493 rushing yards.

headline.main: A Rutgers Walk-On Rushes to the Top

At Rutgers,
Walk-Ons
Shoulder
The Load
